intro: Malvastrum scorpioides, commonly known as the coastal bluemink, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Its fibrous stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves are adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
